column2: Manage assigned commodities to support Trimble s Product supply chains of sourced    components from multiple geographical regions to ensure suppliers meet Trimble    performance standards and quality requirements.        Develop and implement Commodity Strategies that provide BIC (Best in Class) SC quality,    cost, LT, capacity and delivery performance.        Negotiate supplier pricing agreements and contracts, including Supply Agreements, LTAs,    VMI, Buffer, Material Float, and Development.        Drive supplier performance via regular Score Card cadence.        Maintain subject matter expert skill set regarding supply base, market trends, and market    impact conditions.        Identify and evaluate new suppliers to support future technical and capacity    requirements that optimize total cost.        Ensure supply chain flexibility, identify potential risks to production and implement    contingency support plans including buffer stock agreements, and VMI programs.        Monitor financial stability of assigned supply base, identify potential risks, and develop    contingency plans to ensure uninterrupted continuity of supply.        Drive cost reductions through negotiation and identification of global leverage    opportunities, multi-sourcing, LCR strategies, design optimization, and yield    improvements.      Support Other Commodity Managers with tasks such as: negotiations, data analytics and    expedites.          Key Skill Set Requirements:            10+ years of progressive experience managing all aspects of Purchasing and Supply Chain.      Strong experience in all aspects of material and purchasing management with emphasis on the following    key areas:        Background and direct experience in Operations, Direct Procurement, and Commodity        Management supporting PLC (Product Life Cycle) from NPI, through production start-up    to EOL (End of Life).      Technical background and Subject Matter Expertise in Electro-Mechanical Commodities    including Batteries, Stamp/Form/Fab, Gaskets/Seals, Flow Control, Precision    Machining, Metal Casting, Cable Assemblies, Connectors, Hardware and others.      Need to understand how to read engineering document GDT tolerancing and technical specifications and the required secondary processing requirements.        Subject Matter Expert skills: Power user of Excel, Google Sheets, SmartSheets and must be    proficient in Word, PowerPoint, and Project Management scheduling software.      Articulate written and verbal communication skills, with experience presenting cross    functionally and to all levels of management, both internally and to suppliers.      Strong team building skills with experience working with Design Engineering, Operations,    Finance, and other groups in a multinational organization.      Strong negotiation skills with demonstrated history of cost reduction results utilizing    negotiations, reverse auctions, specification optimization, global leveraging, and yield    improvement initiatives.      Demonstrated problem solving and mentoring skills including setting timelines and    diligent follow-up to resolve problems and meet product operations requirements.      Working knowledge of Quality Methods Associated with Designs of Experiments, Gauge    RR, Process Capability, and Statistical Process Control.            Education / Experience:            BSEE/BSME or BS/BA Business with technical experience.    CPM and/or CPIM certification and strong knowledge of MRP.        Minimum 10+ years of experience in the Purchasing/Procurement area.        Minimum 5+ years of experience in Management.          Other Requirements:          Ability to travel on short notice
column11: Procurement, Supply chain, Project management, Process capability, Cost reduction, Scheduling, Subject Matter Expert, Continuous improvement, Team building, Logistics

column2: Youll be responsible for    Sourcing of commodities like Heavy Fabrication, FRP Parts, Ceramic Parts.           Youll be also responsible for Pooling the Steel Structure & Insulators Commodities across the SE Business.         Youll also be responsible for the negotiation with supplier to settle the Best Buying Cost.         You ll will be responsible for Contract/Rate Negotiation, E Auction, Defining Commodity Strategy, Supplier Management, Supplier Risk Monitoring,      Supplier Development, Supplier Conflict Management.         You ll will be responsible for maintaining the Supplier Data in Vendor Master.         Youll also be responsible to train other Team members for deriving the Buying Cost.         Youll work on cost reduction using various techniques like negotiations, alternate process development, design-to-cost, etc.         You will work along with cross functional team members to drive cost reduction projects.          You are a    Mechanical Engineer (B.E. / B.Tech)           You should have 10 to 15 years experience in    Supply Chain Management    or with relevant experience in Strategic Sourcing.         Knowledge of    TcPCM    will be an added advantage.         You should have expertise in deriving Buying cost.         You Should have sound knowledge of Heavy Fabrication Process / operations viz Welding, Plasma/Laser Operation, Punching & Press Operations, Hot Dip Galvanizing, Painting Plating Process.          You Should have sound knowledge of    FRP manufacturing Process Viz - Filament Winding, Vacuum Molding.           You Should have fair understanding of trend of Commodity Market Prices.         You have basic knowledge of SAP.         You ve strong written and verbal communication skills.         You have knowledge of Market / supplier base domain preferably in this industry.          You will take initiative on cost reduction initiatives & demonstrate with pro-active actions for making it happen.          You ve strong passion to work in a team, hardworking & transparent in nature.       ?

column2: Ability to work in a team environment and utilize human resources     Data analysis, Market research, Risk management, supplier     evaluation and selection, cost management and supply chain     management.     Strong negotiation skills, analytical skills, relationship     management, communication skills, risk management, strategic     sourcing skills etc                     Job description           Procurement of raw materials and supplies according to specified       quality requirements, that means support by release of Request for     Quotation (RFQ) and working on Price Comparison     Negotiation of best pricing, delivery times and quality requirements     Release of Purchasing Orders according to Guideline     Check of Order Confirmation with delivery date tracking     Check of Supplier Invoice / WorkFlow ERP-System     Inventory Management, that means Procurement of any materials on     time and right quantity.     Maintenance master data in ERP-System, that means update of     Supplier Master, Part Master (eg delivery times, prices etc)     Supplier Visits / Supplier Audits (both local India + outside India)     General support of Purchasing Process, both operational and strategic     Support by upcoming Supplier Complaints (NCR), that means     collaboration with Quality Management and Technical Engineering to     process Complaint with supplier.     Archiving of documents during and after completion of Purchasing     Process in electronic form (ERP ProAlpha DMS)

column2: Plan, direct, or coordinate the activities of   buyers, purchasing officers, and related workers   involved in purchasing materials, products, and    Purchasing materials, products and services and transportation.       Desired profile       Qualifications:    Graduate in any engineering     Experience:    Min. 5 Years Experience in Procurement   Activities, Experience in Valve Business       Language:    Fluent in English Hindi               Desired skills     - Ability to work in a team environment and utilize human resources   - Data analysis, Market research, Risk management, supplier evaluation and selection, cost management and supply chain management.   - Strong negotiation skills, analytical skills, relationship management, communication skills, risk management, strategic sourcing skills etc.       Job Description     - Procurement of raw materials and supplies according to specified quality requirements, that means support by release of Request for Quotation (RFQ) and working on Price Comparison   - Negotiation of best pricing, delivery times and quality requirements   - Release of Purchasing Orders according to Guideline   - Check of Order Confirmation with delivery date tracking   - Check of Supplier Invoice / WorkFlow ERP-System   - Inventory Management, that means Procurement of any materials on time and right quantity.   - Maintenance master data in ERP-System, that means update of Supplier Master, Part Master (e.g. delivery times, prices etc.)   - Supplier Visits / Supplier Audits (both local India + outside India)   - General support of Purchasing Process, both operational and strategic   - Support by upcoming Supplier Complaints (NCR), that means collaboration with Quality Management and Technical Engineering to process Complaint with supplier.   - Archiving of documents during and after completion of Purchasing Process in electronic form (ERP ProAlpha DMS)
